value.0: Your warrior friend, the flaming azer Calibast, turns to you. He breathes heavily from all of the running and fighting in the last few hours. He eyes the rest of the group, trying to gauge their condition.

Trip, your wererat companion, sniffs the air and licks the blood from a superficial cut on his arm. He does not seem as winded as the others, but his craven ways have kept him from most of the fighting.
Jaboli, a rakshasa wizard, mumbles to herself, obviously trying to recall some of the spells she has already used. It is doubtful she has many more left.
Kaidala's chest heaves as she tries to catch her breath. Her hand absently rubs against the horrible scarring on her face, which she has carried since before you ever met her.
"The enemy lies just ahead. We have to intervene before they seize the keep."
"No, no! We flee! Let them have the keep! We're too late."
"You've led us this far, Trip, only to turn tail on us now?"
"It's the woods! They twist and turn, Jaboli! Trip hoped we get through in time but it's too late. Come, Trip will lead us back to safety."
"No one's going back, Trip, especially not you. We're late but we're not too late. Now, did anyone spy a glimpse of their leader?"
"No. They've led us on a merry chase north, but always stayed a step ahead."
"Trip's gained us some time through the woods but not enough. They'll set fire to the keep."
"Stupid! Trip said we could not fight the big masked man. Not strong enough are we, so now we shall die! We run, we hide and maybe we live!"
"I'll not flee from this or any other foe! We are not cowards; we march for the keep's gates and make our stand against them there. What do you say <FirstName>?"
"If this is our destiny, I would hate to have it said that we did not face it bravely. I will face the storm and weather it or die."
"Then the majority says we stand and fight. That has always been enough for us."
"I... I am sorry... I cannot agree with you, <FirstName>. I say we stand and face our fate."
"Three say stand, two say flee. It is good that we are not all cowards. The vote is cast and the majority says we stand and fight. That has always been enough for us."
"I too will face our foes. Perhaps today we will finally rest."
"You all willing to die? My voices, they tell me to run. Trip wishes to leave here. Why do we not all leave?"
"Bollocks! Shut your cowardly mouth, Trip! We march from this place and face our foes. We must slay the Masked Man at any cost."
"Oh yes, that is a splendid idea! Trip will run far and wide, warning everyone of impending doom!"

"It would take weeks for forces to be mustered. By that time, the keep will have fallen and the Masked One will have moved on, leaving nothing but a smoking ruin. If we're to stop him, it must be now."
"No! Trip does not wish to die. Will no one flee with him?"
"We face them together and with honor!"
"We welcome you, Mistress Death!"
"Hundreds! Trip smells them, yes! Kobolds, orcs, goblins, and ogres. Too many for us I tell you!"
"He usually exaggerates, but I fear Trip is right this time. What do you wish to do?"
"Do you have a plan?"
"Are we just stopping then?"
"What do you think, everyone?"
"You haven't said much, Kaidala. What do you think?"
"Perhaps we should run."
"We stay and fight."
"Trip, you are such a cowardly fool. I ought to end your miserable life right now!"
"Perhaps Trip should run and gather reinforcements?"
"Yes, Trip, be brave!"

Comment.value: Trip flees, but dies before he escapes.

value.0: "How many do we face, best guess?"
